Accessibility Audit Pro

- Single-file Python 3 script using ONLY standard library (json, os, pathlib, hashlib, urllib.parse, webbrowser, tempfile, shutil, argparse).
- CLI app for auditing local files/folders for accessibility issues (alt text simulation, color contrast checker, heading structure analyzer).
- Core audit modes: --file (single HTML), --dir (folder), --url (fetch and audit remote HTML).
- Generate JSON report with PASS/FAIL scores (0-100) saved to current dir as "audit_[hash].json".
- Features:
  * Parse HTML with regex for <img alt="">, heading levels (h1-h6), color contrast (RGB/hex parser).
  * Console table output showing file | score | issues count | top 3 fixes.
  * Keyboard shortcuts in interactive mode: run "audit_pro.py --interactive" for live file watcher.
  * Persistence: maintains audit history in ~/.audit_history.json (auto-backup on exit).
  * Shareable: --share generates short hash ID, prints "python audit_pro.py --load HASH".
  * Drag-drop simulation: copy-paste file paths or use file dialog via input().
  * Offline-first: all processing local, URL fetch uses urllib.request with timeout.
- Command examples:
  * python audit_pro.py --file index.html
  * python audit_pro.py --dir ./public --share
  * python audit_pro.py --interactive
- Output format: color-coded terminal tables (ANSI escape codes), JSON export with remediation suggestions.
- Error handling: validate inputs, handle missing files, network timeouts gracefully.
- Keep under 800 LOC: modular functions (audit_html(), score_file(), print_table(), load_history()).
